clinical_study.brief_title: An Observational Study of the Mean Duration of Herceptin (Trastuzumab) Treatment in Patients With Early or Metastatic HER2-positive Breast Cancer (HERODOT)
clinical_study.official_title: Multicenter, Single-arm, Observational Study of Mean Duration of Trastuzumab Treatment for Early and Metastatic Breast Cancer in Romanian Population (HERODOT Study)

brief_summary.textblock: This single arm observational study will assess the duration and safety of treatment with Herceptin (trastuzumab) in routine clinical practice in patients with early or metastatic HER2-positive breast cancer. Data will be collected from female patients treated with Herceptin according to the Summary of Product Characteristics and local protocols. Duration of observation for each patient is from therapy initiation until permanent discontinuation for any cause.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean duration of Herceptin treatment in routine clinical practice, from start of treatment to permanent discontinuation

secondary_outcome.measure: Reasons for discontinuation of Herceptin therapy
Therapeutic strategies before and during Herceptin treatment
Progression-free survival in metastatic breast cancer
Site of first disease progression during Herceptin therapy in metastatic setting

study_pop.textblock: Female patients with early or metastatic HER2-positive breast cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female patients, >/= 18 years of age
- HER2-positive breast cancer
- Treated with Herceptin in accordance with Summary of Product Characteristics and local protocols
- Written informed consent to data collection
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any contraindication to Herceptin
- Clinically relevant cardiovascular disorder or disease
